I think it's a permission problem
Try to mount it giving access to your user.
Use a uid='your uid' otion
For example, if you are uid=1000
What you can do is put the option 'users' in that fstab entry
That way , you don't need to be root to mount it.
No error?
Fine.
Do you want that partition to be automounted on the system startup?
In that way, you won't be able to access the partition as non privileged user.
Because it will be automounted at startup, as root user.
You should use a uid=<your uid> as another option.
Or you could use 'noauto', but that way it won't be automounted at startup.
